title: W. Va. couple had their dream Halloween wedding in Salem
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Thaddeus and Danielle Martin from West Virginia wed on Halloween at Salem's Willows Park.
The couple, who wore black attire, spent the week on the North Shore before their ceremony.
Their wedding, documented by WBZ, faced strong winds but proceeded as planned.

title: Jaylen Brown continues to shine as Celtics hold off furious 76ers run, win third straight: 9 takeaways
author: Tom Westerholm
bullets: Jaylen Brown scored 32 points, leading the Boston Celtics to a 109-108 victory over the Philadelphia 76ers.
The Celtics achieved their third consecutive win, improving to .500 and starting 1-0 in the NBA Cup's Group B play.
Celtics and 76ers both had 56 rebounds, but Boston had more offensive boards, highlighting their strong performance on glass.

title: Julia Fox defends controversial Jackie O. Halloween costume
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Julia Fox sparked controversy with a Halloween costume mimicking Jacqueline Kennedy's bloodied outfit from JFK's assassination.
Fox attended a Halloween party in the controversial costume, justifying it as a statement on trauma and resistance.
JFK's grandson, Jack Schlossberg, criticized the costume as glorifying political violence, calling it "disgusting and dangerous."

title: Falcons QB Michael Penix Jr., WR Drake London set to play vs. Patriots
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Falcons quarterback Michael Penix Jr. and wide receiver Drake London are set to play against the Patriots in Week 9.
Penix and London missed the Falcons' last game due to injuries but were full participants in the latest practice.
The Patriots enter the matchup with a 6-2 record, riding a five-game winning streak against the 3-4 Falcons.

title: Craig Breslow believes Red Sox are in ‘improved position’ to get ‘right players’ this offseason
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Craig Breslow sees the Red Sox in a better position to acquire key players after their 2025 playoff appearance.
The Red Sox face roster gaps with Alex Bregman, Lucas Giolito, and Trevor Story potentially leaving this offseason.
Boston has $25 million below the luxury tax and a strong farm system to improve the roster.

title: Mike Vrabel says recent Patriots changes have nothing to do with wanting to separate from the past
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Mike Vrabel has implemented changes to Patriots' pregame introductions, dropping the 24-year team introduction tradition.
Vrabel insists changes are not to escape the Patriots' past but to focus on winning and competitive play.
Patriots are 6-2 under Vrabel, leading the AFC East with changes to team culture and communication.

title: Bruins’ Elias Lindholm will miss ‘a few weeks’, Khusnutdinov promoted to 1C
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Elias Lindholm will miss a few weeks due to a lower-body injury sustained in a game against the Sabres.
Marat Khusnutdinov is promoted to top-line center, joining David Pastrnak and Morgan Geekie on the Boston Bruins.
Lindholm's absence impacts Bruins' power play, where he scored all four of his goals this season.

title: Photos: The best moments from Salem on Halloween 2025
author: Kelly Chan
bullets: Thousands of tourists in costume visited Salem, Massachusetts, for Halloween celebrations, flooding the streets and local attractions.
Popular spots included Essex Street and the Salem Witch Museum, where visitors enjoyed markets, performances, and spooky decorations.
Events featured a Witches’ Circle on Salem Common, various costumed attendees, and interactions with local haunted history sites.

title: Moulton, without proof, accuses Trump of abusing girls with Epstein in tense TV interview
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Rep. Seth Moulton accused Trump of abusing girls with Jeffrey Epstein, without providing evidence, during an MSNBC interview.
Moulton claims Trump is mentioned in Epstein files and criticizes Republicans for corruption, targeting Trump in upcoming elections.
MSNBC host Joe Scarborough challenged Moulton's accusations, emphasizing lack of evidence and urging focus on proven issues with Trump.

title: Brian Walshe’s next court appearance scheduled as cellphone evidence remains accessible
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Brian Walshe's murder trial jury selection begins Nov. 18, after a mental health evaluation and pre-trial conference.
Judge Krupp ordered preservation of cellphone evidence related to former State Police Trooper Michael Proctor for Walshe's defense.
Prosecutors revealed Proctor's phone had sensitive information; defense aims to review potentially exculpatory materials.
